author: Sven Schumann
title: A Lot of Sorrow - König Galerie, St. Agnes, Berlin
text:
Photo: Courtesy of König Galerie
A Lot of Sorrow is a collaboration between Icelandic artist Ragnar Kjartansson and the band The National. The concept is simple: In 2013 Kjartansson asked the band to play its song “Sorrow” at
MoMA P.S.1 for six hours straight, without any breaks, for a total of 105 repetitions of the song. A video of the performance is currently on exhibit in Berlin in connection with the release of a limited-edition box set of nine transparent LPs. I went to the opening of the show last week at gallerist Johann König’s privately owned Brutalist church. Although I didn’t last the full six hours and only saw the band repeat the song 20-odd times, I have to say that there is something quite beautiful about sitting inside a cavernous, half-empty church while watching five guys perform a song about depression over and over again.
A Lot of Sorrow is on view at König Galerie, St. Agnes, Berlin, through August 23.
Photo: Courtesy of Sven Schumann
